result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric M Nedland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric M Nedland in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Eric M Nedland in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF46.  16CF46-State will amend to 948.02(1)(d), State recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea quesionnaire/waiver of rights.  Parties recommend 12 years total- 8 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision, CC, DNA sample and surcharge, sex offender registry, no voting until civil rights are restored, no firearms, DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will DRI 16CF43, and any uncharged counts in MN.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  DE has 336 days credit.  DE will be eligible for SAP, not for CIP.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 21, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Eric M Nedland in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Eric M Nedland in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF46.  Agreement has been reached in these matters.  Set for plea/sentencing  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing on January 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Eric M Nedland in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Eric M Nedland in custody.  James Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF46.  Set for RH 1-31-17 @ 10:00AM.
Plea of not guilty and demand for twelve person jury trial
Review hearing on December 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Review hearing on December 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Eric M Nedland in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  James Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in Session - DA Babbitt makes statement and requests adjournment - Defense attorney explains reason for adjournment - Matter adjourned to 12/5/16 at 3:00 p.m. - Court adjurned 2:59 p.m.
Review hearing on September 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Eric M Nedland in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Eric M Nedland in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF46.  Set for RH date for both cases.  JA to schedule.
Review hearing on July 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Eric M Nedland in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Eric M Nedland in custody.  Heard along with 16CF46.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CF43-Waive reading of information, enter plea of NG.   16CF46-PH, DE/Atty will waive PH, court instructs on waiver of PH, court will accept waiver. Court finds probable cause exits, will bind over for JT.  Information filed, will proceed to arraignment-waive reading of information, enter a plea of NG.  Set for RH 7-26-16 @ 11:00AM

Defendant Eric M Nedland in court.  Attorney Chris Petros appears for defendant Eric M. Nedland. James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in Session 10:08 a.m. DA Rennicke states appearances 16CF43 - (PH) - 16CF46 (Init. App.) - Attorney Petros states his client will waive the PH today on 16CF43 - Court questions Mr. Nedland - he agrees and waives the PH.  Court makes finding and waives PH - Information has been filed and enters a NG plea on his behalf.  Existing bond will continue.  Court continues on with 16CF46 - Init. App. - matter to be scheduled for PH w/in 10 days.  Attorney Petros states he has not been assigned to this matter yet.  Client and Attorney waive time limits for the PH.  Court instructs defendant on waiver.  Court finds waiver of time limits is accepted by the Court. JA to schedule all future hearings.   Both cases will be scheduled for futher proceedings together.  Court adjourned 10:13 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Eric M Nedland in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Eric M Nedland in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond.  State wishes for bond to remain, or higher cash bond ordered as they have several concerns of other matters.  Court will continue cash bond as ordered.  Set for PH 3-31-16 @ 10:00AM.
